commit.message:
configure.in: Check for system-provided 'uchar' type.

	* configure.in: Check for system-provided 'uchar' type.
	* configure, config.in: Regenerate.
	* cpphash.h: Only typedef 'uchar' if the system doesn't.

From-SVN: r61516

files.patch:
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
 2003-01-20  Zack Weinberg  <zack@codesourcery.com>
 
 	* configure.in: Check for system-provided 'uchar' type.
-	* configure: Regenerate.
+	* configure, config.in: Regenerate.
 	* cpphash.h: Only typedef 'uchar' if the system doesn't.
 
 2003-01-20  Richard Henderson  <rth@redhat.com>

@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-/* config.in.  Generated automatically from configure.in by autoheader.  */
+/* config.in.  Generated automatically from configure.in by autoheader 2.13.  */
 
 /* Define if using alloca.c.  */
 #undef C_ALLOCA
@@ -498,6 +498,9 @@
 /* Define if <time.h> defines clock_t. */
 #undef HAVE_CLOCK_T
 
+/* Define if <sys/types.h> defines `uchar'. */
+#undef HAVE_UCHAR
+
 /* Define .init_array/.fini_array sections are available and working. */
 #undef HAVE_INITFINI_ARRAY

@@ -5158,6 +5158,43 @@ EOF
 
 fi
 
+echo $ac_n "checking for uchar""... $ac_c" 1>&6
+echo "configure:5163: checking for uchar" >&5
+if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_type_uchar'+set}'`\" = set"; then
+  echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
+else
+  cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
+#line 5168 "configure"
+#include "confdefs.h"
+
+#include "ansidecl.h"
+#include "system.h"
+
+int main() {
+if ((uchar *)0) return 0;
+ if (sizeof(uchar)) return 0;
+; return 0; }
+EOF
+if { (eval echo configure:5179: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_uchar=yes
+else
+  echo "configure: failed program was:" >&5
+  cat conftest.$ac_ext >&5
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_uchar=no
+fi
+rm -f conftest*
+fi
+
+echo "$ac_t""$gcc_cv_type_uchar" 1>&6
+if test $ac_cv_type_uchar = yes; then
+  cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
+#define HAVE_UCHAR 1
+EOF
+
+fi
+
 # Restore CFLAGS from before the gcc_AC_NEED_DECLARATIONS tests.
 CFLAGS="$saved_CFLAGS"
 
@@ -5168,23 +5205,23 @@ if test "${enable_initfini_array+set}" = set; then
 else
   
 echo $ac_n "checking for .preinit_array/.init_array/.fini_array support""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5172: checking for .preinit_array/.init_array/.fini_array support" >&5
+echo "configure:5209: checking for .preinit_array/.init_array/.fini_array support" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_initfini_array'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
     if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   gcc_cv_initfini_array=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5180 "configure"
+#line 5217 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 static int x = -1;
 int main (void) { return x; }
 int foo (void) { x = 0; }
 int (*fp) (void) __attribute__ ((section (".init_array"))) = foo;
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5188: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:5225: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   gcc_cv_initfini_array=yes
 else
@@ -5212,12 +5249,12 @@ fi
 
 # mkdir takes a single argument on some systems. 
 echo $ac_n "checking if mkdir takes one argument""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5216: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
+echo "configure:5253: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5221 "configure"
+#line 5258 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <sys/types.h>
@@ -5234,7 +5271,7 @@ int main() {
 mkdir ("foo", 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5238: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5275: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg=no
 else
@@ -5274,22 +5311,22 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for main in -lunwind""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5278: checking for main in -lunwind" >&5
+echo "configure:5315: checking for main in -lunwind" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo unwind'_'main | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lunwind  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5286 "configure"
+#line 5323 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 main()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5293: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5330: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -5575,14 +5612,14 @@ fi
 
             
 echo $ac_n "checking for library containing strerror""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5579: checking for library containing strerror" >&5
+echo "configure:5616: checking for library containing strerror" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_search_strerror'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_func_search_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 ac_cv_search_strerror="no"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5586 "configure"
+#line 5623 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5593,7 +5630,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5597: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5634: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_search_strerror="none required"
 else
@@ -5604,7 +5641,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
 test "$ac_cv_search_strerror" = "no" && for i in cposix; do
 LIBS="-l$i  $ac_func_search_save_LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5608 "configure"
+#line 5645 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5615,7 +5652,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5619: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5656: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_search_strerror="-l$i"
 break
@@ -5638,12 +5675,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5642: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:5679: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5647 "configure"
+#line 5684 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -5692,7 +5729,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5696: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5733: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -5713,12 +5750,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5717: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5754: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5722 "configure"
+#line 5759 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5746,12 +5783,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5750: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5787: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5755 "configure"
+#line 5792 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5781,19 +5818,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5785: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5822: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5790 "configure"
+#line 5827 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5797: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5834: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -5814,12 +5851,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5818: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:5855: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5823 "configure"
+#line 5860 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -5847,7 +5884,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5851: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5888: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -5879,12 +5916,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5883: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:5920: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5888 "configure"
+#line 5925 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -5909,12 +5946,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5913: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:5950: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5918 "configure"
+#line 5955 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5937,7 +5974,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5941: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5978: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5964,15 +6001,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5968: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6005: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5976 "configure"
+#line 6013 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -5991,7 +6028,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5995: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:6032: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -6014,12 +6051,12 @@ fi
 
 
     echo $ac_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6018: checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer" >&5
+echo "configure:6055: checking whether we are using the GNU C Library 2.1 or newer" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_gnu_library_2_1'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6023 "configure"
+#line 6060 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <features.h>
@@ -6055,17 +6092,17 @@ stdlib.h string.h unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6059: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:6096: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6064 "configure"
+#line 6101 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:6069: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:6106: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -6096,12 +6133,12 @@ getgid getuid mempcpy munmap putenv setenv setlocale stpcpy strchr strcasecmp \
 strdup strtoul tsearch __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6100: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6137: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6105 "configure"
+#line 6142 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6124,7 +6161,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6128: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6165: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -6165,15 +6202,15 @@ fi
 
 
   echo $ac_n "checking for iconv""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6169: checking for iconv" >&5
+echo "configure:6206: checking for iconv" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_func_iconv'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   
     am_cv_func_iconv="no, consider installing GNU libiconv"
     am_cv_lib_iconv=no
     cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6177 "configure"
+#line 6214 "configure"

 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <iconv.h>

        iconv_close(cd);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF

+if { (eval echo configure:6224: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_func_iconv=yes
 else
@@ -6195,7 +6232,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
       am_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
       LIBS="$LIBS $am_cv_libiconv_ldpath -liconv"
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6199 "configure"
+#line 6236 "configure"

 #include <stdlib.h>

@@ -6205,7 +6242,7 @@ iconv_t cd = iconv_open("","");
          iconv_close(cd);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF

+if { (eval echo configure:6246: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_lib_iconv=yes
         am_cv_func_iconv=yes
@@ -6226,13 +6263,13 @@ echo "$ac_t""$am_cv_func_iconv" 1>&6
 EOF
 
     echo $ac_n "checking for iconv declaration""... $ac_c" 1>&6

-#line 6236 "configure"
+#line 6273 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdlib.h>
@@ -6251,7 +6288,7 @@ int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6255: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then

   am_cv_proto_iconv_arg1=""

-echo "configure:6284: checking for nl_langinfo and CODESET" >&5

 ; return 0; }

     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6319: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:6356: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6324 "configure"
+#line 6361 "configure"

 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6331: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6368: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then

     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
